SEARCH
Package user

Class Restaurant

java.lang.Object
user.User
user.Restaurant
public class Restaurant extends User
Represents a Restaurant in the MyFoodora system. This class extends User and provides functionalities for managing a restaurant's profile, menu, discounts, and order history.
Author:
Aymane Adib

  • Constructor Details

    • Restaurant

      public Restaurant(String name, String username, String password, Location location) throws BadUserCreationException
      Constructs a new Restaurant instance.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the restaurant.
      username - the username for the restaurant's account.
      password - the password for the restaurant's account.
      location - the physical location of the restaurant.
      Throws:
      BadUserCreationException - if an error occurs during user creation.

  • Method Details

    • orderHistory

      public ArrayList<Order> orderHistory(MyFoodora system)
      Retrieves a list of all orders that have been placed with this restaurant.
      Parameters:
      system - the main MyFoodora system instance which holds the global order history.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Order objects associated with this restaurant.

    • getPrice

      public double getPrice(Order order, Customer customer)
      Calculates the final price of an order for a given customer, applying their fidelity card discount.
      Parameters:
      order - the order for which to calculate the price.
      customer - the customer who placed the order.
      Returns:
      the final price of the order as a double.

    • addDish

      public void addDish(Dish dish)
      Adds a new dish to the restaurant's menu.
      Parameters:
      dish - the Dish to be added to the menu.

    • removeDish

      public void removeDish(Dish dish)
      Removes a dish from the restaurant's menu.
      Parameters:
      dish - the Dish to be removed from the menu.

    • addMeal

      public void addMeal(Meal meal)
      Adds a new meal to the restaurant's menu. A meal typically consists of several dishes.
      Parameters:
      meal - the Meal to be added to the menu.

    • removeMeal

      public void removeMeal(Meal meal)
      Removes a meal from the restaurant's menu.
      Parameters:
      meal - the Meal to be removed from the menu.

    • setGeneralDiscount

      public void setGeneralDiscount(double discount)
      Sets a general discount percentage for all items on the menu. This discount is applied to meals that are not marked as special offers.
      Parameters:
      discount - the discount percentage (e.g., 0.1 for 10%).

    • setSpecialDiscount

      public void setSpecialDiscount(double discount)
      Sets a special discount for meals of the week. This discount is applied only to meals designated as special offers.
      Parameters:
      discount - the special discount percentage (e.g., 0.2 for 20%).

    • getGeneralDiscount

      public double getGeneralDiscount()
      Gets the general discount percentage applied to the menu.
      Returns:
      the general discount as a double.

    • getSpecialDiscount

      public double getSpecialDiscount()
      Gets the special discount percentage for meals of the week.
      Returns:
      the special discount as a double.

      public Location getLocation()

      Updates the location of the restaurant.
      Parameters:
      location - the new Location for the restaurant.

    • getMenu

      public Menu getMenu()
      Gets the restaurant's menu.
      Returns:

    • getDishByName

      public Dish getDishByName(String dishName)
      Finds and returns a dish from the menu by its name.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the Dish object if found, otherwise null.

    • getOrderCounter

      public int getOrderCounter()

      Returns:
      the total order count.

    • setOrderCounter

      Sets the order counter to a specific value.
      Parameters:
      orderCounter - the new value for the order counter.

    • incrementOrderCounter

      public void incrementOrderCounter()
      Increments the order counter by one. This is typically called each time a new order is completed.
